alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 5:10AM MDT until June 15 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. .High water levels will occur today through Wednesday. For the Wind River Basin...including Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast through Wednesday. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding downstream along left bank near Black Bridge begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. At 10.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area. Water begins to encroach homes along the right bank. At 11.0 feet, Major flooding of homes along the right bank. Water begins to encroach low lying areas west of Highway 789. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM MDT Monday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the last 12 hours ending at 4:15 AM MDT Monday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above flood stage with a maximum value of 10.5 feet tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
